title: The Star
description: A small but brave donkey and his animal friends become the unsung heroes of the greatest story ever told, the first Christmas.

reviews.text: Its not going to win any awards, but if you are looking for a fun family film that covers the true story of Christmas in a fun way then you will love this movie.  While it throws biblical accuracy out the window, its still fun and enjoyable.  I would recommend for Children up to age 12.The animation on this film is excellent and really surprising for what was certainly not a big budget animation film.
It might not be the next Pixar's "Inside Out", but it is fun and enjoyable. Great for kids, but if you are an adult who believes in the Spirit of Christmas, you'll probably enjoy it as well.

I think this film is a fun new way to reenact the birth of jesus christ and how they didn't stray to far away from the actual story to be offensive, even so the humor is not all the funny and if your not christian you most likely won't enjoy this movie.

Not surprising that this would get lambasted by critics - anything that attempts to portray events in the Bible without subverting it somehow is never going to get a fair shake.But this movie surprisingly does just that - in 2017, we have a theatrical release of a movie that does a fairly decent job of retelling the birth of Christ, through the eyes of the donkey Boaz who longs to be part of the royal caravan.  Many of the events are expanded on/fictionalized/time-compressed, but overall it stays true to the Christmas story. Themes of friendship, faith, and redemption are all present in spades. Both traditional and non-traditional Christmas songs are peppered throughout, and for the most part are well done.There are a couple of poop jokes that feel very out of place given the subject matter, but that sort of thing seems to be written in the contract of all kids movies these days. The main antagonist is pretty scary, and (IIRC) he dies at the end, so keep that in mind when bringing young children.  But my 5 and 8 year old enjoyed it very much; they saw it twice - once as a free pre-release screening (full disclosure), then again once it was in the theaters. It's not destined to be a seasonal classic, but for those who are looking for a modern movie that aims to tell the actual story of the holiday rather than some nebulous "spirit of Christmas" schlock, this is pretty good.
